attributes.action: Relax the requirement for smoking signage for retail premises
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Having just received my go smoke free pack from the local council I am amused to see the requirement for an A5 No Smoking sign to be displayed at the entrance to all enclosed public places.

As at small business retailer I am part of a very long row of small shops. 
As each of these retail units are now BY LAW required to display this A5 sign at the entrance to the property or risk a £250.00 fixed penalty all the public will be faced with is a barrage of signs every 5 to 6 meters along both sides of the street.

I have no problem with the law itself but I think the requirement to display the signs in shop doorways along a high street needs to be reconsidered, and some common sense applied.
